Package: au.com.redboxresearchdata.harvester.json.transformer

[Groovy] Class JsonTransformationHandler

    • au.com.redboxresearchdata.harvester.json.transformer.JsonTransformationHandler

    • Transformer for creating JSON strings using the JsonFactory class.

      Authors:
      Shilo Banihit

      • Method Detail

        • @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Transformer org.springframework.integration.Message<java.lang.String> handleCsvJdbc(@org.springframework.integration.annotation.Payload java.util.List<java.util.Map> payload, @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Header("type") java.lang.String type, @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Header("original_file") java.lang.Object origFile)

          Used to transform an entire CSVJDBC resultset to a JSON harvest request message. Please see http://csvjdbc.sourceforge.net/ for details about CSVJDBC

          Parameters:
          payload
          type - - a "type" header
          origFile - - a "original_file" header, specifying the csv File reference or path
          Returns:
          JSON harvest request message.

        • @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Transformer org.springframework.integration.Message<java.lang.String> handleCsvJdbcUsingHarvestType(@org.springframework.integration.annotation.Payload java.util.List<java.util.Map> payload, @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Header("type") java.lang.String type, @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Header("original_file") java.io.File origFile, @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Header("harvestType") java.lang.String harvestType)

          Used to transform an entire CSVJDBC resultset to a JSON harvest request message. Please see http://csvjdbc.sourceforge.net/ for details about CSVJDBC

          Parameters:
          payload
          type - - a "type" header, matching record table
          origFile - - a "original_file" header, specifying the csv File reference or path
          harvestType - - overall harvestType
          Returns:
          JSON harvest request message.

        • @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Transformer org.springframework.integration.Message<java.lang.String> handleFile(org.springframework.integration.Message<java.io.File> inputMessage)

          Default file handler: loads the contents of the file as message payload. Sets the filename, file size, file extension, filename without extension as headers. It also sets the FileHeaders.ORIGINAL_FILE File reference.

          Parameters:
          inputMessage
          Returns:
          SI Message with String payload.

        • @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Transformer org.springframework.integration.Message<java.io.File> handleFileHeaders(org.springframework.integration.Message<java.io.File> inputMessage)

          Sets the headers specified at handleFile<java.io.File>, but places the File reference to the payload. Also sets a "type" header: the file name less the extension.

          Parameters:
          inputMessage
          Returns:

        • @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Transformer org.springframework.integration.Message<java.lang.String> handleJdbc(@org.springframework.integration.annotation.Payload java.util.List<java.util.Map> payload, @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Header("type") java.lang.String type)

          Used to transform a List of Maps or a JDBC-like result set to a JSON harvest request message. Requires a "type" header that specifies the data type of the result set.

          Parameters:
          payload
          type
          Returns:
          JSON harvest request message.

        • @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Transformer org.springframework.integration.Message<java.lang.String> handleRecord(@org.springframework.integration.annotation.Payload java.util.Map payload, @org.springframework.integration.annotation.Header("type") java.lang.String type)
